user_instruction: 'Send Sarah an update on our current project status. You can check out my Gmail and Notion for information.'

formatted_items.arguments:
{"to":["sarah@sterlingfinance.com"],"subject":"Re: Request for Current Project Status Update – Investment-Strategy Presentation","body":"Hi Sarah,

Here’s a quick snapshot of where we are:

• Timeline – Presentation is scheduled for next week (Thu 3 July, 10:00 a.m.). We are on track.

• Slide deck – Core narrative and design framework are complete (≈80%). Remaining work:
   – Drop in the latest market-analysis charts (waiting on final data refresh tonight).
   – Fine-tune risk-return section once we have those numbers.

• Market trends report – I’ve attached the updated report in Notion; please review and adjust slides 7–10 accordingly.

• Coordination – I’ll integrate your edits and circulate a near-final draft by Wednesday noon for exec review.

• No blockers – All other milestones met; new algorithm figures already incorporated.

Let me know if you need anything else.

Best,
John"}

formatted_items.content:
Thought process:

1. Identified Sarah’s request: wants a concise status update on the investment-strategy presentation.
2. Searched Notion for “investment-strategy presentation” and “market trends report” to pull the latest documented details (presentation scheduled next week, slides ~80 % done, pending market-analysis data, etc.). These pages provided concrete progress points and outstanding tasks.
3. Queried Gmail for any recent e-mails referencing the presentation; none appeared, confirming Notion held the most relevant info.
4. Composed an email that:
   • States key timeline (date/time for presentation).  
   • Quantifies slide-deck completion (≈80 %).  
   • Lists specific remaining tasks (insert refreshed charts, refine risk-return section).  
   • Points Sarah to the updated market-trends report in Notion, specifying which slides she should edit.  
   • Notes next coordination step (near-final draft by Wednesday noon).  
   • Confirms no current blockers.
5. Sent the email to Sarah with a clear subject line and structured bullet points for easy scanning.
